Their pathetic equipment matches the command's trust in their fighting abilities. There is even an old military joke starting with a question: what is the most common organic fertilizer used by Fossorians to revitalize the battlefields? By now, you can surely guess the answer.

The Ratling Gunners are the best goods made in the slums and the true reason these halfbreeds are tolerated in the colony. The slums are soaked in violence, drugs, and a traditional voodoo cult mixed with twisted Fossorian propaganda. A week in such a hellhole is enough to make a warrior crazy good - or simply crazy.

The Meatboy tradition originates from ancient warriors seeking glory in the blood-soaked sand of the arena. A lovely story that is naturally pure propaganda. The truth is buried in the underground research complex full of dead scientists and horribly mutated test subjects. Let's hope that "the truth" will never break out of its containment.

With the right training and a proper nutrition plan, everybody can become as buff as a Meatboy! Inspiring, right? What a skinny Fossorian doesn't see are the hundreds of needles pumping a cocktail of steroids into every muscle in the body. So long, weakness, farewell anxiety, goodbye testicles, see you ... wait, what?!

Only one in ten adepts survive the extensive cybernetic augmentation required to operate Hammerite power armor. They believe that the armor "chose" them, but if you saw the chop shop's sanitary conditions, you'd suspect it was just their immune systems.

The rocket hammer is a mighty weapon. Hammerites spend years learning the martial "Way of the Hammer". But if they need fresh meat fast, it's a "Here is your new hammer; this button will ignite the thruster. Please clean the blood of the previous owner" crash course.

Earthshaker operators address each other as One-way fliers. If you wonder why, remember that they sit on a big pile of explosives, sloppily secured against spontaneous combustion. They are either exceptionally brave or just monumentally stupid. I guess it depends on how close you stand on launch day.

After many fruitless years, the Upgraded Earthshakers project caught the Supreme leader's attention. Once heads started rolling, the project team made a miraculous breakthrough. The mark-II design boosted only one thing. The firepower!

For Tunnel Worms, death doesn't mean the end of the service. No, no, we are not speaking about "The Urowormos", the afterlife nonsense taught by the high-as-a-kite witchdoctors in the Ratling Slums. We are discussing that weird kebab you've been served in the local cantina.

In prehistoric times the entire Fossorians race was nearly wiped out by these ferocious predators. Nowadays, Panzer worms are a product of careful breading and neuro-castration. Still, no sedation nor a cruel taming process can extinguish the carnivore instincts of these living weapons.

The commissars are so ideologically obsessed they can order a planetary bombardment on their own troops and call it a clear victory. But perhaps they get some credit for lowering the number of deserters, cowards, and loafers - by eliminating troops with those traits - another clear victory, ain't it?

Once the commissar ranks are cleared (primarily by fragging) of the loud, suicidal charge types, surprised commanders discover that those remaining do a ton of heavy lifting in combat without the over-the-top heroics.

Everybody knows that the Supreme Leader himself designed the Liberator. Anyone else who tried to take credit for it vanished. (Along with their families and friends.) Even the goldfish in the team's office disappeared and the entire engineering wing was wrecked for good measure.

The mechanics have a saying, "Every machine is a smoke machine if you operate it wrong enough". But this time, it is actually the other way around. The toxic gas produced by a Mass Liberator is something you WANT to have on the battlefield. Preferably in the lungs of your enemies, though.

Skaurov's face looks like a battlefield. Terrifying scars silently testify to long and thorough torture. Some say he was the Supreme Leader's second, perhaps even a childhood friend during the revolution. Only one thing is known for sure. All the big names from the revolution were convicted of treason shortly after its success, except for Skaurov.

The self-appointed commander of special forces carries the smug of a rock 'n' roll star. In a perfectly tailored uniform and black glasses, he became the face of the propaganda posters sooner than they managed to get rid of him. In the present he is untouchable but he knows he's running on the very edge of the blade.

A notorious mercenary. He'll be your most loyal commander till the first hint of trouble. One heartbeat later, he's undressing the nearby corpse of an enemy officer and turning coat.\n \n Though unpopular among other warlords, he is an indispensable part of most black ops conducted by Fossorians.

Combine the personality of Judas with chameleon skin, and you'll get a Molsson. In the last few months, he has inspired more revolutionaries than the bearded fellow's brochure during the summer of 1848. He then turned them all in for treason. Agent Molsson considers himself a master of disguises and a smooth-talking womanizer.\n \nAn anomaly for his species, he has developed a taste for a human-made beverage known as a Martini. "Stirred, not shaken".

A true muscle-minded tank-brain, but our heroic Liberator Brigades couldn't wish for a better leader. Srg. Moltair's victories are the stuff of legends (and according to the dictionary, many legends are based on truth). Reports from the battlefield proudly sing about his achievements! 27 victories in 22 battles. What a mole!

No one knows what kind of favor Tott provided the Supreme Leader to score such a lucrative post, but everyone can see that since granted the rank of Tax Collector, his influence over Fosorian colonies has grown steadily. His flamboyant lifestyle of chic uniforms and decadent parties reeks of tax evasion on an epic scale, but no one dares snitch on him because anyone with the power to do so either already attends these lavish shindigs or desperately wants to.

A former hero partisan commander during the Nemek rebellion. \n \nThe Nemek was the only agricultural vessel in the Fosorian fleet. The ship's commanders tried to capitalize on this by establishing one of the Admirals as a new supreme leader. It led to a two-week-long battle in the ship's grow tunnels that ultimately concluded in the destruction of the ship by Moletoff's commandos. The rest of the fleet nearly died of hunger, but luckily the Siren system was not far. To his great wonder, Moletoff was not executed but promoted to the rank of Lieutenant.

During the first clash between Fossorians and the UNSS, he commanded the infamous dreadnought Supreme Fist and became notorious for the only spaceship ramming attempt recorded in the 24th century. Now he's a captain without a ship. Though mocked by the other warlords, he's the only captain to discover a fundamental flaw in the UNSS ship shielding — their inability to stop low-velocity objects.

The only true officer, who joined the rebellion and kept the rank... and head. \n \nYou can tell the difference right away because the graduate of the military academy can come up with a much more sophisticated strategy than the usual evergreen of the former plumbers dressed in uniform "Just send mole wave after mole wave and we will see!".

Rumor has it that Beni has been caught by Fossorian warlords and faced the firing squad at least three times but somehow still walks free and unharmed. Yet there is another, utterly unrelated rumor about five identical brothers born in the slums of old Fossoria.\n \nMany believe that the fourth firing squad will also fail. The fifth one, though, has a pretty good chance of succeeding.

The former child star adored for her beautiful facial features matching the ideal of Fossorian beauty.\n\n When she joined the Hammerites everybody considered it a mannerism of the spoiled starlet. Nobody knew the psychotic raised by the studio producers would be the next Lord Commander.

By Tradition, the Supreme Leader's past is glorious but mostly fabricated. \n \nThe word Mostly is of utmost importance because this is not your usual fat spoiled child of a degenerated dynasty. This fat spoiled degenerate was thrown to the meatgrinder of the biggest and boldest revolution in the Fossorian history and emerged victorious. He is dangerous. Perhaps the most dangerous Fossorian alive.

Flying ace of the Nemek rebellion. He has flown with nearly every type of ship Fossorian fleet and crushed many more. Like all the unsuccessful rebels, he tried to blend in with the population but betrayed by his idealist nature, he was swiftly recognized and sent to the prison colony on the edge of the Fossorian territory.

As the revolution elevated many individuals unsuited for their role the first big purge reversed the process. Many untouchables quickly learn the limits of their immunity. Though the corruption scandal that kicked the stool from under Furret's feet was partially constructed and there are much bigger fish in the pool filled with dirty money, some children must be eaten first.
